content: you don t want the forelegs then continue with wings as follows ref figs 27 & 28 1 working on one side of the felt wing at a time pinch up a furrow about 2mm in a slightly curved line as directed by the top line on the template below 2 pin in place in necessary then stitch along each furrow to create one long ridge 3 with yarn b cast on 4 sts and work 2 x two inch long i-cords either using two dpns or the single-pointed needles method on page 17 just working on the 4 sts cast off 4 attach each i-cord by working a few stitches to one end of the i-cord joining it to a part of the top wing furrow as shown in fig 27 attach the other end of the i-cord to the side of the body as shown - try to make it look as seamless as possible remember you can brush the mohair to smudge it in/ blend it a bit 5 once both sides of the wings are attached to the two i-cords - one on each side of the body you can join the wings to the back of the neck and at the feet as on page 26 fig 27 fangs ref fig 30 1 if you d like fangs and claws simply thread up some white sewing cotton or embroidery thread single stand and work small stitches for fangs slightly larger ones for the claws you might like to see it visually here fig 28 https //tinyurl com/vjdfn6bt remember to get in touch if you need a little extra advice and of course there is more much more to learn create and be inspired by here @dotpebbles_knits please also remember that this pattern like all of my patterns is copyrighted this prohibits copying or reproducing any of its writing content for your own profit however if you want to sell what you ve made from any of my patterns then that is perfectly fine - i actually encourage it and have an instagram account @imadethisrabbit_shop to promote you reach out with #imadethisrabbit_shop and please do share what you ve created from this pattern #dotpebbles_knits #dotpebblescreatureland
